intro: Machaeranthera glabella, commonly known as the plains coreopsis, is a flowering plant native to the central and western United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as prairies and disturbed soils. It produces yellow to orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The leaves are lance-shaped and often have a hairy texture, contributing to its adaptability in arid environments.
